dmca.title: ProjectVisa wants to stop text from travelling
dmca.body:
Dear Sir or Madam,

1. The copyrighted work at issue is the text that appears on http://www.projectvisa.com In short almost the entire site has been copied. I am contacting you to make a formal complaint against two websites listed in your Search index.

I have been made aware that a website included in the alltheweb Search index, apparently has copied the content of several hundred pages from my own site at
http://www.projectvisa.com. To the best of my knowledge the entire sites at www.passportvisa.org is a copy of my own website, with the logo and layout changed, and some extra words added.

A very cursory list of stolen material includes text at:
http://passportvisa.org/visa.html http://passportvisa.org/Visa/Afghanistan-Visa/Afghanistan-Visa.html http://passportvisa.org/Visa/Bangladesh-VisaBangladesh-Visa.html http://passportvisa.org/VisaBBhutan-VisaBhutan-Visa.html 
and on, and on, and on...

I am under no illusion that this is an isolated or honest mistake even a cursory look at the visa information of the website should be sufficient to determine that http://passportvisa.org/ is made up of stolen content from Projectvisa.com. Prompt action on your part would be most appreciated.

My Contact Information:
[private]
[private]
[private]
Western Australia
[private]@yahoo.com

Infringer's Contact Information:

[private]
[private]
Pune Maharashtra
India
[private]@yahoo.com
 
2.		I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials described above on the allegedly infringing web pages is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law.
3.		I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.

Sincerely,
[private], Owner Projectvisa.com

Phone: +61 [private]
Email: [private]@yahoo.com
